brief_summary.textblock:
This is a behavioral speech therapy trial for individuals who have suffered a stroke on the
      left side of the brain and have difficulty speaking. The name of this disorder is called
      "aphasia." Individuals in this study will receive one of two treatments. The first is a
      phonological (sound level) treatment and the second is a semantic (word level) treatment.
      Individuals in both groups will receive 60 hours of therapy for free (2 hours/day, 5
      days/week, 6 weeks).

clinical_study.brief_title: Speech Therapy for Aphasia: Comparing Two Treatments

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Single, left-hemisphere stroke

          -  English as primary language prior to stroke

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Other neurological disorders

          -  Untreated depression

intervention.description: We will compare two treatments for aphasia. Each participant will receive only one form of treatment.
intervention.intervention_name: Speech therapy for aphasia: comparing two treatments

intervention.description: Control therapy; current standard of care therapy

facility.name: VA Puget Sound Health Care System, Seattle

clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Controlled Study of Rehabilitation of Anomia in Aphasia

overall_official.affiliation: VA Puget Sound Health Care System, Seattle

primary_outcome.description: Participants from both groups will be asked to name pictures not exposed during treatment.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Participants from both groups will be measured on response latency during picture naming task. Response latency will be calculated for both trained and untrained items.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: immediately and 3 months following treatment termination

secondary_outcome.description: Participants from both groups will be measured on verb naming accuracy. Verbs will be a linguistic context not exposed in treatment.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
